results.title: Happy riding. Part 1
results.creator_credit: BBC Cymru Wales, Vis News, Euryn Ogwen-Williams and Mark Lawton
results.brief_description: One of a series which examines the art of horse riding. This film deals with buying a pony and other aspects such as what to look for when buying a pony, horse sales, postures, fencing and shelters, feeding, equipment, stable management and veterinary reports

results.title: Happy owls
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel, W. Snyder and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A pair of owls live happily together in an old ruin. One of the birds from a neighbouring farm, a peacock, observes their happiness and wonders at this achievement, as the birds he lives with are always squabbling and discontented. When the ducks, chicks and geese have congregated together the owls tell them a story illustrating the secret of their happiness. Unfortunately the birds refuse to believe or to learn. Based on the book by Celestino Piatti.

results.title: Happy locomotive
results.creator_credit: Unifilm, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company and Stephen Fitzgerald
results.brief_description: An animated film describing the dangers which confront an engine driver. Many of the hazards are caused by unthinking people, children and vandals. Accidents could be avoided if the public remembered simple safety rules.

results.title: Happy little Vegemites = Cheap rush
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Dead Head Films and Colin Mowbray
results.brief_description: A furiously energetic short film about young homeless people who spend a night in emergency accommodation. They are bored and decide to search for some speed. When their efforts prove fruitless one of them decides that maybe a dose of vegemite might to the trick! With an excellent young cast and tight scripting, “Happy Little Vegemites” manages to be both comic, and in the scenes between the naive Gerard and the streetwise Chad, effectively touching. Features an excellent music track including Radiohead, Beasts of Bourbon and Rebecca’s Empire. Be warned, vegemite may never look the same again!

results.title: Happy landing (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Clive Holloway
results.brief_description: The program aims to show how the problems posed by ‘real world’ perceptual tasks (for example landing an aircraft) may lead to a different kind of perceptual theory than that normally generated by laboratory experiments. NB. Tape blank for first minute.

results.title: Happy go lovely
results.creator_credit: Associated British Picture Corporation, Marcel Hellman and Bruce Humberstone
results.brief_description: This Anglo-American musical/comedy “Happy go lovely” is set in Edinburgh, Scotland, during the Edinburgh festival. A desperate theatre director is staving off creditors and his production hangs in the balance when his leading star quits. None of his crew have been paid properly and are demanding remuneration. Janet Jones (Vera Ellen) is a chorus girl mistaken for the fiancee of local multi-millionaire B.G. Bruno. As a result she is promoted to leading lady and showered in gifts from local dress stores. Rumours drift back to Bruno about Miss Jones and when he calls on her she mistakes him for a reporter, Charlie. As Charlie/Bruno woos Janet complications ensue in a classic case of mistaken identity. The film features numerous song and dance sequences, many of which are in the style of ballet.

results.title: Happy Gilmore
results.creator_credit: MCA/Universal, MCA/Universal Home Video, Robert Simonds and Dennis Dugan
results.brief_description: Happy Gilmore has an anger management problem, which could be really helpful if he could achieve his dream of becoming a professional ice hockey player. However he is a lousy skater. When his beloved grandmother loses her home to the IRS he desperately tries to find a way to raise the money. Quite by accident he discovers that his hockey slap shot translates to an amazingly accurate 400 yard golf tee shot. So he decides to join the pro golf tour, brining his ferocious temper and outlandish antics to the well-tended fairways. Before long he is a media sensation, attracting hordes of followers and news cameras wherever he goes. A rivalry between Happy and nasty golf pro ‘Shooter’ heats up, resulting in a riotous confrontation on the once-hallowed golf links.

results.title: Happy birthday
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andy Thomson, Wolf Koenig and Jefferson Lewis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. A young couple’s marriage is threatened over a decision as to whether the husband should accept a job researching poison gas for military purposes. The wife is adamantly opposed. Regardless of their decision, someone will take the job. Should one morally accept responsibility for the consequences?
